sect2.para: The DHCPCD package provides a DHCP Client for network configuration.

sect2.title: Installation of DHCPCD

note.para: This build is optional. You only need to build this if you intend on using a DHCP Server to automatically configure at least one network interface on your system.

screen.userinput: make PREFIX=/usr BINDIR=/sbin SYSCONFDIR=/etc \ DBDIR=/var/lib/dhcpcd LIBEXECDIR=/usr/lib/dhcpcd

sect2.para: This package does not come with a test suite.

screen.userinput: make PREFIX=/usr BINDIR=/sbin SYSCONFDIR=/etc \ DBDIR=/var/lib/dhcpcd LIBEXECDIR=/usr/lib/dhcpcd install

listitem.para: dhcpcd is an implementation of the DHCP client specified in RFC 2131. It gets the host information from a DHCP server and configures the network interface automatically.
